oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DESIGN FEATURES OF THE UPCOMING COASTAL AND OCEAN BASIN IN OSTEND, BELGIUM
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Troch, Peter
Stratigaki, Vicky
Devriese, Peter
Kortenhaus, Andreas
De Maeyer, Jeroen
Monbaliu, Jaak
Toorman, Erik
Rauwoens, Pieter
Vanneste, Dieter
Suzuki, Tomohiro
Verwaest, Toon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The new Coastal and Ocean Basin (COB) located at the Greenbridge Science Park in Ostend, Belgium is under construction since February 2017. The laboratory will provide a versatile facility that will make a wide range of physical modelling studies possible, including the ability to generate waves in combination with currents and wind at a wide range of model scales. The facility is serving the needs in Flanders, Belgium, in the fields of mainly offshore renewable energy and coastal engineering. The COB will allow users to conduct tests for coastal and offshore engineering research and commercial projects. The basin will have state-of-the-art generating and absorbing wavemakers, a current generation system, and a wind generator. It will be possible to generate waves and currents in the same, opposite and oblique directions. The basin is expected to be operational in 2019. This paper presents an overview of the basin's capabilities, the ongoing work, and selected results from the design of the COB.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 36 (2018): Proceedings of 36th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Baltimore, Maryland, 2018; papers.94
